citations.narrative:
On 12/7/2023, a saw-whet owl was discovered to have a wound (@ 1cm in length) on the leg under the anklet, which was
unexpectedly tight. Anklets were removed, veterinary care was provided, and the wound healed. Swelling of digits 2 and 3
during healing resulted in loss of the talon on digit 2, but the owl is using the limb and foot to roost and eat normally.
Handling and equipment used to handle animals must be used as carefully as possible in a manner that does not result in
trauma or discomfort. The facility must ensure that handling does not induce injury.
The facility resolved this injury by immediate removal of anklets and provision of veterinary care at the time of discovery
on December 07, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.131(b)(1)  Critical
   
Handling of animals. 
On 12/7/2023, a saw-whet owl was discovered to have a wound (@ 1cm in length) on the leg under the anklet, which was 
unexpectedly tight. Anklets were removed, veterinary care was provided, and the wound healed. Swelling of digits 2 and 3 
during healing resulted in loss of the talon on digit 2, but the owl is using the limb and foot to roost and eat normally. 
Handling and equipment used to handle animals must be used as carefully as possible in a manner that does not result in 
trauma or discomfort. The facility must ensure that handling does not induce injury. 
 
The facility resolved this injury by immediate removal of anklets and provision of veterinary care at the time of discovery 
on December 07, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
